result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Morgan-Marino was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony Morgan-Marino is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony Morgan-Marino was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony  Morgan-Marino in court with attorney Michael Arthur Kelsey.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State offers Application Pursuant to Wisconsin Statute 967.055(2).  Court approves application;  Ct. 1 & Ct 2 are dismissed by Court.  Joint Recommendation; parties stipulate to facts; advised of rights; Defendant pleads NC to Ct. 3; court finds guilty and convicts on Ct. 3.  Fine/court costs totaling $579.00; 60 days to pay. Plea Questionnaire field.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Anthony M. Marino in custody by video.  John Yackel in court for the State. Bond continues.

1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
Anthony M. Marino in custody by video.  John Yackel in court for the State. Cash bond set w/STOP conds. Random testing required.
